supporting_text: The NAP outlines a One Health approach that integrates human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP addresses animal health through targeted actions to reduce AMR in livestock.
The NAP includes actions focused on environmental health and its impact on AMR.
The NAP outlines strategies to address AMR in agriculture and food security.
The NAP specifies the establishment of a reporting mechanism to monitor progress.
The NAP sets specific targets with timelines for achieving AMR-related goals.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for monitoring AMR prevalence and antimicrobial usage.
The NAP outlines budget allocations for various AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for AMR activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral task force to coordinate AMR efforts.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen the legislative framework for AMR.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives aimed at increasing AMR awareness.
The NAP includes public awareness campaigns to engage communities in AMR issues.
The NAP emphasizes international collaboration with key organizations for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes strategies for developing AMR surveillance systems and data collection tools.
The NAP outlines actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP includes specific prevention strategies focused on sanitation and hygiene.
The NAP incorporates international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP mandates the rational use of antibiotics through specific regulations.
The NAP includes participation in international research collaborations for AMR solutions.
